author: ansgar.eth
content: Not sure if this is the correct channel, but I was wondering about the gas cost to send value with a call. Right now this cost is 9000 for any `CALL` with non-zero `value`. 2300 of this is for the stipend, leaving 6700 as the actual cost. I assume this is supposed to cover the two state reads and writes for the sender and recipient balances. Should this then not also be covered under the 2929 cold/warm state access costs? Seems to me 6700 is overcharging in general, but especially if either of the balances was already warm?

author: wjmelements
content: agree. another suggestion: COINBASE account should start warm

author: jochembrouwer
content: Thinking of this precompile stuff, I actually just started to wonder why active precompiles are added to the warm accounts. It is true that we can just read the code from memory, but if we `BALANCE` them then we still have to read the state trie..? (Or call them with value)

author: sky.cactus
content: I think the idea is that clients can/should keep the entire account for precompiles warm?

author: sky.cactus
content: Though, it would be nice if calling them could be warm while balancing them could be cold.
